abstract.text: An accessory as presented by the discovery picker.

inlineContent.text: that describe the accessories you want to discover. Each item contains a name and product image to display, plus an
that identifies the kind of accessories to match. Pass these in an array to
to display a picker that allows the person using your app to discover and select nearby accessories.
Filter the matched accessories by supplying a
, which contains various Bluetooth and Wi-Fi properties to match. The descriptor also allows you to set the
of matched accessories; set its value to
to limit discovery of Bluetooth accessories to those within the immediate proximity of the device running your app.
To enable different behaviors during setup, use the
property, which is an option set (Swift) or bitfield (Objective-C) of behavior options. The defined options in
allow you to specify behaviors like allowing renaming of the accessory during setup, or confirming accessory authorization before showing the setup view.

discovering-configuring-accessories-Page.alt: An illustration that shows Bluetooth and Wi-Fi devices communicating.

abstract.text: Enable privacy-preserving discovery and configuration of accessories.
Options that affect the behavior of an accessory renaming operation.
Present a picker that shows discovered accessories matching an array of display items.
Descriptive traits used to discover accessories.
A range in the immediate vicinity of the device performing accessory discovery.
A property that tells the session to discover accessories within a specific Bluetooth range.
A previously-discovered accessory as presented by the discovery picker, for use when migrating it to AccessorySetupKit.
An accessory as presented by the discovery picker.
Setup options offered by the accessory picker.
A descriptor that the picker uses to determine which discovered accessories to display.
Creates a picker display item with a name and image to display and a descriptor to match discovered accessories.
The accessory name to display in the picker.
An image of the accessory to display in the picker.
Options to allow renaming a matched accessory.
Custom setup options for the accessory.
Detect nearby accessories and facilitate their setup.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
